data.name: Swablu

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

data.name: Girafarig

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Lovestrike
attacks.text: Does 40 more damage for each Nidoqueen on your Bench.

data.flavorText: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

data.name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove from Carnivine the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Bagon

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Almost Flight
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If Lotad has any Water Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Lotad is 0.

data.name: Bagon
data.flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

data.name: Happiny

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.

attacks.name: Lively
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves round white things. It carries and egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Poochyena

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Vigoroth.

data.name: Charizard V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Primal Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Trainer Cards that have Fossil in their names, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sleep Swirl
attacks.text: Both Relicanth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

data.name: Diglett

attacks.name: Mine
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, you may have your opponent shuffle his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

data.name: Umbreon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Veil of Darkness
attacks.text: Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Then, draw that many cards.

attacks.name: Endgame
attacks.text: If your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards.

data.name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Swalot. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Swalot's, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Reuniclus

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

data.name: Gambler
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charmander. Flip a coin. If tails, discard 1 of those cards.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Yamask

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card at random from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

data.name: Solosis

attacks.name: Cell Culture
attacks.text: Search your deck for Solosis and put it into your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.

data.name: Barraskewda

attacks.name: Spiral Jet
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you don't, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

data.name: Buneary

attacks.name: Drawup Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Extend Ears
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Dragalge

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

data.name: Nihilego-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Empty Light
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Symbiont-GX
attacks.text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

data.name: Mew

abilities.name: Neutral Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

data.name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Brain Control
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a card from there and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It can manipulate an opponent's memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

abilities.name: Primal Stare
abilities.text: As long as Omastar is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spook
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Scizor can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snatch
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with no damage counters on it and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Scizor. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Inteleon

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

data.name: Reshiram-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Scorching Column
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Vermilion-GX
attacks.text: You may attach up to 5 Fire Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Toxicroak

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Exact Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Fighting Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, base damage of Vigoroth's Slash is attack is 90 instead of 40.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

data.name: Vibrava

attacks.name: Energy Typhoon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile. Then, put those Energy cards on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

data.name: Bewear

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

attacks.name: Night Spirits
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Sabrina's Gastlys, Sabrina's Haunters, and Sabrina's Gengars you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.

data.name: Gothorita

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

data.name: Florges

attacks.name: Brilliant Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

data.name: Unown [P]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Perform]
abilities.text: If an attack damaged Unown [P] during your opponent's last turn and Unown [P] was your Active Pokémon, Unown [P]'s Hidden Power attack does that much more damage to the Defending Pokémon. This power can be used even if Unown [P] is Confused.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Corphish by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Unown [N]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Normal]
abilities.text: Whenever a Colorless Pokémon damages 1 of your Pokémon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This power stops working if you have more than 1 Unown [N] in play. (This power works even if Unown [N] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Gnaw Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Sneaky Attack
attacks.text: If Raticate has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Static Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electro Ball
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.

data.name: Seaking

attacks.name: Enhanced Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, flip 6 coins instead.

data.flavorText: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.

data.name: Shelgon

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.

data.name: Unown [Q]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Quicken]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to any of your Pokémon with Unown in its name during your opponent's next turn. If you have more than 1 Unown [Q] in play, use only 1 [Quicken] each turn. This power can be used even if Unown [Q] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Regirock

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Land Maker
attacks.text: Put 2 Stadium cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.

data.name: Oricorio

abilities.name: Vital Dance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies.

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

data.flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

data.name: Koga's Trap
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Terraforming
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck and rearrange them as you like. This power can't be used if Machamp is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Iron Fist
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon you have in play with damage counters on them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of those Pokémon.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

data.name: Mankey

attacks.name: Three-Step Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Spiritomb

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Damage Play
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

data.name: Black Kyurem

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dazzling Blizzard
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

data.name: Drowzee

abilities.name: Long-Distance Hypnosis
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Drowzee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Inteleon

attacks.name: Silent Shot
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Hydro Snipe
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.flavorText: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Because every PRINPLUP considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

data.name: Goodra

attacks.name: Liquid Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Colorless in its Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shining Breath
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

data.flavorText: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

data.name: Professor's Research (Professor Magnolia)
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Boldore

attacks.name: Smack Down
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

data.name: Unown [U]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Undo]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [U], Unown [N], Unown [D], and Unown [O] on your Bench, you may return your Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Aftermath
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Smogbank
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Inhaling toxic fumes from trash and mixing them inside its body lets it spread an even fouler stench.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.flavorText: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Good Night
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Good Morning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon was Asleep, it is no longer Asleep.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Mach Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Magma Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.

attacks.name: Gouge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Wailmer (all if there are less than 4). Wailmer is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wailmer but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Uplifting Glow
abilities.text: As long as Illumise is in play, Volbeat's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic Vibration
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Crobat

attacks.name: Triple Poison

attacks.name: Surprise Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can't move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gothitelle

attacks.name: Doom Decree
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Black Magic
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tapu Fini

attacks.name: Nature Wave
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Ultra Beasts in play, this attack can be used for Colorless.

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Dense Body
abilities.text: Any damage done to Slowbro by attacks from Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each Energy attached to Slowbro but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

data.name: Seviper

attacks.name: Tail Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: For many generations, it has feuded with ZANGOOSE. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

data.name: Cubone

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

data.flavorText: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It's soaking up static electricity because it can't produce a charge on its own.

data.name: Xatu

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

data.name: Spritzee

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

data.name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

data.name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

data.name: Duosion

attacks.name: Recover

data.flavorText: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thought, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.

data.name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

data.name: Elgyem

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.

data.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Goodnight, Babies
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave both Active Pokémon Asleep.

data.flavorText: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

data.name: Eiscue

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

abilities.name: Disrupting Spy

attacks.name: Search and Escape
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put Chatot G and all cards attached to it on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Swablu

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sharp Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

data.name: Grumpig

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

data.name: Cofagrigus

attacks.name: Lock Up

data.flavorText: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Roselia

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Blaine's Doduo.

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Burmy Sandy Cloak during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

data.name: Tapu Koko-GX

data.name: Giratina ◇
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

data.flavorText: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

data.name: Turtonator-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nitro Tank-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sandshrew

data.flavorText: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.

data.name: Darkrai-EX

attacks.name: Night Spear

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

data.name: Spoink

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Paranormal
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Ultra Beasts.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Hoopa

attacks.name: Hyperspace Ring
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

data.name: Toxicroak

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove that Special Condition from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

abilities.name: Raging Roar

attacks.name: Dark Mountain
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. This attack does 50 more damage for each Supporter card discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

data.name: Liepard

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

data.name: Misdreavus

attacks.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

data.flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

data.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

data.name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.

data.name: Pawniard

attacks.name: Charge Order
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pawniard.

data.flavorText: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

data.name: Lapras

abilities.name: Go for a Swim
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

data.name: Scraggy

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

data.name: Carbink

attacks.name: Crystal Barrier
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wonder Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fairy Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Born from temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

data.name: Diglett

abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Dig Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

data.name: Poipole

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Knockout Reviver
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."

attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a sterile environment, the germs within its body can't multiply, and it dies.

data.name: Eiscue V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cold Absorption
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, heal 30 damage from it.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Psykiss
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It always rocks its head slowly backwards and forwards as if it is trying to kiss someone.

data.name: Chatot

attacks.name: Mimic

data.flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.

attacks.text: If there is no Stadium card in play, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

data.flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

data.name: Rayquaza-EX

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt

data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

data.name: Pangoro

abilities.name: Benevolent Boss
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, it gets +20 HP for each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crazy Knuckle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won't put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Helicoptero
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.

data.name: Blaine's Last Stand
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Draw 2 cards for each Fire Pokémon you have in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Shot Air
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.

data.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Reflexive Retaliation
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

data.name: Elgyem

attacks.name: First Contact
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.

data.name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fighting Energy, attach it to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

data.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Shining Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached to it, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Thunder Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for Magikarp and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metapod and a Butterfree card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: A rare and unique Pokémon about which little is known, as few have been captured.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Golem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Megaton Fall
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Rotom Bike
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

attacks.name: Naptime
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Sabrina's Slowbro and Sabrina's Slowbro is now Asleep. If Sabrina's Slowbro has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Screaming Headbutt
attacks.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

data.name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Chikorita takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

data.flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.

data.name: Cherrim

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Cherrim is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Barboach.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Mudkip is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Mudkip by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Prison
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

data.name: Remoraid

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

data.name: Grumpig

attacks.name: Magical Step
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on the Confused Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Grumpig.

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

data.name: Aerodactyl
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Old Amber Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Ancient Scream
abilities.text: Your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

data.name: Golett

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magmar.

data.flavorText: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Bronzor during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

data.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Rummage
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose as many Trainer cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Shadow Sneak
attacks.text: If you and your opponent have a different number of Prize cards left, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Important Errands
attacks.text: Search your deck for a React Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

data.name: Unown [Z]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Zoom]
abilities.text: As long as Unown [Z] is Benched, you pay no Energy cost to retreat a Pokémon with Unown in its name.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

data.name: Cresselia

attacks.name: Lunar Payback
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

data.name: Hoothoot

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

data.name: Venipede

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

data.name: Salamence

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Power Howl
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Steam Blast
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's uncontrollable if enraged. It flies around spouting flames and scorching fields and mountains.

data.name: Salamence

abilities.name: Breakwing
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Crush
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changed, and wings grew out.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aron by attacks is reduced by 10.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards there.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put those cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Edge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Path-GX
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: As long as Beldum is your Active Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat Beldum for each Beldum on your Bench.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Beldum does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Air Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Skarmory by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Duskull

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It loves the crying of children. It startles bad kids by passing through walls and making them cry.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Act Tough
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

data.name: Xatu

attacks.name: Energy Cycle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Attach that Energy card to that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.

data.name: Espeon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Miraculous Shine
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

data.name: Magby
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Catch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Lucha Fight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.

data.name: Arctovish

attacks.name: Hard Face
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 60 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Life Shaker
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Psychic Pokémon to another of your Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Blaine's Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Primal Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to Evolve or to Level-Up the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

data.name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shocking Pursuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

data.name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.

attacks.name: Sudden Growth
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to Politoed.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Splash
attacks.text: Move 2 Water Energy cards attached to Politoed to 1 or 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You may put both on the same Pokémon or 1 each on 2 different Pokémon.) If you have no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

data.name: Chewtle
data.flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

data.name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

attacks.name: Night Attack
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
